revised_title: Electrical and Magnetic Properties of Low-Dimensional Mercury Compounds
tldr: This article investigates the electrical and magnetic properties of low-dimensional mercury compounds, focusing on chain and sheet structures. The electrical resistivity of chain compounds decreases with decreasing temperature, while the layered compounds exhibit metallic behavior from 300 to 1.4 K. The anisotropy in resistivity and the Fermi surface model provide insights into the unique structure and conduction properties of these compounds.
